doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Ladislaus von Hoffmann held on June 28, 1990
doc.abstracts: On February 11, 1988, Ladislaus Von Hoffmann was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1960 to 1977, Mr. Von Hoffman worked in the following areas: for the International Finance Corporation (IFC) department of investments for Africa, Asia, and the Middle East as an assistant director (1963-1965) and as a director (1965-1970); and for the IFC as vice president (1970-1974) and as executive vice president (1974-1977). This interview was conducted for the George Woods biography. His transcript concerns work in the Middle East building up export organization; work on private investment under Suharto in Indonesia; and the design of innovative investment contracts in industry.
